Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that "not one single school project" has been started or completed in the last two years, which is contradicted by the fact that 27 SDA-managed emergent projects were completed during that time.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that 27 SDA-managed emergent projects were completed during the last two years.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the assertion that "not one single school project" has been started or completed.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the lack of completed school projects is solely due to the inaction of New Jersey Schools Development Authority employees, without considering other factors or potential obstacles.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the delay or non-completion of school projects, such as changes in administration or funding issues.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by making sweeping generalizations about the inaction of New Jersey Schools Development Authority employees without acknowledging the completion of 27 SDA-managed emergent projects.
Understate: The claim understates the completion of 27 SDA-managed emergent projects by stating that "nothing" has been done to address emergency repairs.
